intro: Xanthostemon multiflorus f. elegans, commonly known as the elegant flamewood, is a striking flowering plant native to northern Australia. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy inflorescences. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers, which are clustered in dense, branched spikes. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in coastal or sandy habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes in suitable climates.
